title: Operation Midland was so inept that heads must roll
text:
The Henriques Report into Operation Midland concludes that Scotland Yard was too ready to believe the absurd fantasies of Carl Beech, a liar and paedophile who claimed that several public figures raped, and even murdered children. Instead of testing his claims, officers declared them to be “credible and true” and, according to Sir Richard Henriques, warrants to search homes of innocent men were secured “unlawfully”. Lives were ruined. Harvey Proctor, for example, lost his job and his home.

Labour MP Tom Watson passed “information” on to the Metropolitan Police, and his intervention “created further pressure upon officers”. The Met, which wanted to rescue its image after the Savile scandal, acted...
